meanings.definition: Chintses (verb): to be stingy or unwilling to spend money
meanings.sent1: She always chintses when it comes to buying gifts for others.
meanings.sent2: He chintses on buying new clothes, preferring to save his money instead.
meanings.sent3: The millionaire decided to chintses on buying a yacht, opting for a small boat instead.
meanings.sent4: Her father's tendency to chintses on household expenses was compared to a squirrel hoarding nuts.
meanings.sent5: The image of Scrooge chintses on coal for the fire is a classic example of being frugal.

meanings.definition: Chintses (adjective): cheap or of poor quality
meanings.sent1: The store was filled with chintses items that no one wanted to buy.
meanings.sent2: She regretted buying the chintses shoes that fell apart after a week.
meanings.sent3: The chintses toy car broke as soon as it was taken out of the box.
meanings.sent4: The chintses necklace turned her skin green after wearing it for a few hours.
meanings.sent5: The chintses paint job on the car started peeling off within days of being applied.
